verses.kjv: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.
verses.ct: "I have entered my garden, my sister, my bride. I have harvested my myrrh along with my spices. I have tasted my honeycomb and my honey. I have savored my wine and my milk." Enjoy yourselves, friends! Drink deeply, lovers!

verses.kjv: I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.
verses.ct: I was asleep, but my heart was wide awake. Listen — my love was knocking! "Let me in, my sister, my darling, my dove, my perfect one. My hair is soaked with dew, my curls dripping with the moisture of the night."

verses.kjv: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
verses.ct: "I've already taken off my robe — should I really put it back on? I've already washed my feet — should I get them dirty again?"

verses.kjv: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.
verses.ct: My love reached his hand through the opening of the door, and my heart stirred with longing for him.

verses.kjv: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.
verses.ct: I got up to let my love in, and myrrh dripped from my hands — fragrant myrrh flowing from my fingers onto the bolt of the lock.

verses.kjv: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.
verses.ct: I opened the door for my love, but he had turned and gone. My soul sank when he had spoken. I searched for him but couldn't find him. I called out to him, but he didn't respond.

verses.kjv: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
verses.ct: The guards patrolling the city found me. They struck me and injured me. The sentinels on the walls tore my veil away from me.

verses.kjv: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.
verses.ct: I'm pleading with you, young women of Jerusalem — if you find my love, tell him that I am overwhelmed with love for him.

verses.kjv: What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?
verses.ct: What makes your love better than anyone else's, most beautiful of women? What sets him apart from all others, that you would plead with us like this?

verses.kjv: My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.
verses.ct: My love is radiant and healthy-looking, standing out among 10,000 men.

verses.kjv: His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.
verses.ct: His head gleams like the purest gold. His hair is wavy and dark as a raven.

verses.kjv: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.
verses.ct: His eyes are like doves beside flowing streams, bathed in milk and perfectly set.

verses.kjv: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
verses.ct: His cheeks are like beds of spices, like fragrant blossoms. His lips are like lilies, dripping with sweet-scented myrrh.

verses.kjv: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.
verses.ct: His arms are like rods of gold adorned with jewels. His body is like polished ivory decorated with sapphires.

verses.kjv: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
verses.ct: His legs are like marble columns resting on bases of fine gold. His appearance is majestic as Lebanon, as striking as its cedars.

verses.kjv: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: His kisses are pure sweetness — everything about him is desirable. This is my love, and this is my closest friend, young women of Jerusalem.
